availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Caldwell County Court
October Term 1861
Monday October 21st 1861.

On motion, it is ordered that James M. Harper be and he is hereby appointed as sheriff of this county (for the unexpired time of Jesse stevens who has resigned), whereupon the said Harper took the oath as required by the constitution and laws of the state of Kentucky, and together with James B. Sasseen John F. Morse, William Nichols and Bryant Nichols his sureties, entered into and acknowledged bond payable to the Commonwealth of Kentucky for the faithful discharge of his duty, conditioned according to law.

A copy
Attest
James C. Weller clk
Per J. Charles Barnes D. C.

Caldwell Co
Jas. M Harper
Sheriff
vice
Jesse Stevens
resigned
